title: Terminator star Linda Hamilton made to wear breast and bum padding to reprise role as Sarah Connor
text:
Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton during the filming for the Graham Norton Show at BBC Studioworks 6 Television Centre, Wood Lane, London, to be aired on BBC One on Friday evening. (Photo by Isabel Infantes/PA Images via Getty Images)

Terminator: Dark Fate star Linda Hamilton has revealed she was made to wear bottom and breast padding for the latest movie - despite working out and dieting a year before shooting began.

The 63-year-old actress made the revelations while appearing on BBC One’s The Graham Norton Show on Friday (18 October).

Read more: Linda Hamilton Reveals She's Been Celibate for 'At Least 15 Years'

Appearing alongside co-star Arnold Schwarzenegger, Hamilton said: “I Leaned out, worked for a year. Didn’t have carbohydrates for a year, then I show up on set and they were like ‘well we have to build you a butt’ - which is interesting after a year of working out and leaning down they had to actually add ass.

“I would take pictures of my t**s and a** when I would get up in the morning and I’d get into my trailer and send it to my kids - ‘t**s, a**’ they we are - we’re going to be fine.”

The star also revealed she ignored calls from the movie’s producer James Cameron, who she was married to in the 1990s, until he made it clear he wanted to discuss the work.

View photos Titanic Director James Cameron celebrates with wife Linda Hamilton 24 March at the Titanic party in Los Angeles after the film won 11 Academy Awards. AFP PHOTO LUCY NICHOLSON (Photo credit should read LUCY NICHOLSON/AFP via Getty Images) More

She told host Graham Norton: “We don’t talk at all. He rang three times and it was only on the third call when he mentioned it was about work that I rang him back!”

She added: “It took me a little while to decide if I had something more to do with her character.”

Read more: Terminator stars Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton – then and now

It is the first starring role Hamilton has had in a Terminator movie since 1991’s Terminator 2: Judgement Day. She first played the now iconic role of Sarah Connor in the 1984 movie, The Terminator. The franchise was created by Cameron, and he took the directing role in the first two movies.

Sat alongside Hamilton, Schwarzenegger praised his co-star, saying: “Linda set the bar high for all female action roles. She really is a bad ass!”

View photos Linda Hamilton and Arnold Schwarzenegger attend the "Terminator: Dark Fate" photocall on October 17, 2019 in London, England. (Photo by Dave J Hogan/Getty Images) More

They were joined on the show by Blondie star Debbie Harry, Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain, DJ Spoony and the newly reformed Sugababes.
description: 63-year-old told Graham Norton it was 'interesting' considering year-long work out plan prior to shooting
